properties.name: Namespace
properties.description: A unique namespace that identifies the option's associated AWS resource.

type.description: A unique namespace that identifies the option's associated AWS resource.

properties.name: OptionName
properties.description: The name of the configuration option.

type.description: The name of the configuration option.

properties.name: ResourceName
properties.description: A unique resource name for the option setting. Use it for a time–based scaling configuration option.

type.description: A unique resource name for the option setting. Use it for a time–based scaling configuration option.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The current value for the configuration option.

type.description: The current value for the configuration option.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag.

type.description: The key name of the tag.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag.

type.description: The value for the tag.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: The name of this environment tier.

type.description: The name of this environment tier.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The type of this environment tier.

type.description: The type of this environment tier.

properties.name: Version
properties.description: The version of this environment tier. When you don't set a value to it, Elastic Beanstalk uses the latest compatible worker tier version.

type.description: The version of this environment tier. When you don't set a value to it, Elastic Beanstalk uses the latest compatible worker tier version.

properties.name: ApplicationName
properties.description: The name of the application that is associated with this environment.

type.description: The name of the application that is associated with this environment.

properties.name: CNAMEPrefix
properties.description: If specified, the environment attempts to use this value as the prefix for the CNAME in your Elastic Beanstalk environment URL. If not specified, the CNAME is generated automatically by appending a random alphanumeric string to the environment name.

type.description: If specified, the environment attempts to use this value as the prefix for the CNAME in your Elastic Beanstalk environment URL. If not specified, the CNAME is generated automatically by appending a random alphanumeric string to the environment name.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Your description for this environment.

type.description: Your description for this environment.

properties.name: EnvironmentName
properties.description: A unique name for the environment.

type.description: A unique name for the environment.

properties.name: OperationsRole
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an existing IAM role to be used as the environment's operations role.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an existing IAM role to be used as the environment's operations role.

properties.name: OptionSettings
properties.description: Key-value pairs defining configuration options for this environment, such as the instance type.

type.description: Key-value pairs defining configuration options for this environment, such as the instance type.

properties.name: PlatformArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom platform to use with the environment.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom platform to use with the environment.

properties.name: SolutionStackName
properties.description: The name of an Elastic Beanstalk solution stack (platform version) to use with the environment.

type.description: The name of an Elastic Beanstalk solution stack (platform version) to use with the environment.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: Specifies the tags applied to resources in the environment.

type.description: Specifies the tags applied to resources in the environment.

properties.name: TemplateName
properties.description: The name of the Elastic Beanstalk configuration template to use with the environment.

type.description: The name of the Elastic Beanstalk configuration template to use with the environment.

properties.name: Tier
properties.description: Specifies the tier to use in creating this environment. The environment tier that you choose determines whether Elastic Beanstalk provisions resources to support a web application that handles HTTP(S) requests or a web application that handles background-processing tasks.

type.description: Specifies the tier to use in creating this environment. The environment tier that you choose determines whether Elastic Beanstalk provisions resources to support a web application that handles HTTP(S) requests or a web application that handles background-processing tasks.

properties.name: VersionLabel
properties.description: The name of the application version to deploy.

type.description: The name of the application version to deploy.
